segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
My name is Katherine.
And as you know, we've had a series going about small talk in English, so today's lesson is a part of that series.
segments.cn: 正如你们所知，我们有一系列关于英语小谈的课程，所以今天的课程是这一系列的一部分。

segments.en: That's right.
Today we're going to listen to two friends, two girlfriends, meeting and they haven't seen each other for a long time, so we're just going to see how they quickly have a small conversation.
segments.cn: 今天我们将听两个朋友，两个女友见面，她们很久没见面了，所以我们来看看她们如何快速进行小对话。

segments.en: Hey, Michelle, is that you?
Wow, Grace, long time no see.
Where have you been?
Oh, yeah, well, you see, I got a promotion, so I moved to the new Pudong office last September.
segments.cn: 哦，是的，你看，我升职了，所以去年九月我搬到了新的浦东办公室。

segments.en: You did?
Congratulations.
Thanks a lot.
So how are things with you, Michelle?
Well, same old, same old, you know.
Nothing much has changed here.
Are you still seeing Chris?
No, actually, we split up last month.
segments.cn: 不，实际上，我们上个月分手了。

segments.en: Oh, dear.
I'm sorry to hear that.
But I met a really cute guy last night at a networking party.
segments.cn: 但我昨晚在一个社交聚会上遇到了一个非常可爱的男孩。

segments.en: So, well, let's just wait and see.
segments.cn: 所以，嗯，我们就等着看吧。

segments.en: Good for you, Michelle.
All right, we're back.
So now let's take a look at some of the language on Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看Language Takeaway中的一些语言。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
So the first word we have here today, Marco, is the word promotion.
segments.cn: 今天我们要讨论的第一个词是“升职”。

segments.en: Grace says, Well, you see, I got a promotion, so I moved to the new Pudong office.
segments.cn: Grace说，嗯，你看，我升职了，所以我搬到了新的浦东办公室。

segments.en: That's right.
So she got a promotion, and a promotion is work-related.
segments.cn: 她升职了，升职是与工作相关的。

segments.en: That means that you got a better position.
segments.cn: 这意味着你得到了更好的职位。

segments.en: That's right.
But you didn't change companies.
So in your company, you had a job, and you did well in that job, and so your boss gave you a better job in the company, and that's a promotion.
segments.cn: 所以在你的公司里，你有一份工作，你在那份工作中表现良好，因此你的老板给了你更好的职位，这就是升职。

segments.en: That's right.
Okay, so she got a promotion.
That's when they were talking about work, and now they started talking about their personal life, and Grace asked if Michelle is still seeing Chris.
segments.cn: 这是她们谈论工作时的情况，现在她们开始谈论个人生活，Grace问Michelle是否还在和Chris交往。

segments.en: Okay, so the verb here is to see someone, to be seeing someone.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这里的动词是“见某人”，即“在交往”。

segments.en: We're not actually talking about eyes and looking.
segments.cn: 我们实际上并不是在谈论眼睛和看。

segments.en: We're talking about dating.
That's right.
So if you're seeing Chris, it means you are dating Chris.
segments.cn: 所以如果你在和Chris交往，那就意味着你在约会Chris。

segments.en: Okay, so that's an interesting way of describing a relationship.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一种描述关系的有趣方式。

segments.en: So you say, Yeah, I'm sorry.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说，嗯，我很抱歉。

segments.en: I'm seeing someone.
I can't date you.
I'm seeing someone else.
Or you could ask someone, Are you seeing anyone right now?
segments.cn: 或者你可以问某人，你现在在和谁交往吗？

segments.en: That means, Are you dating anyone?
Do you have a boyfriend, basically?
Okay.
And sadly, no, they are not together anymore.
segments.cn: 可悲的是，他们不再在一起了。

segments.en: She says, Actually, we split up last month.
segments.cn: 她说，实际上，我们上个月分手了。

segments.en: Alright, so this is another relationship term.
segments.cn: 好的，这又是一个关系术语。

segments.en: To split up means to break up, or to stop dating.
segments.cn: “分手”意味着结束交往，或停止约会。

segments.en: To stop seeing each other.
So there are two ways of seeing it, as you said, to split up or to break up.
segments.cn: 所以有两种说法，正如你所说，分手或结束交往。

segments.en: That's right.
So unfortunately, they split up, or unfortunately, they broke up.
segments.cn: 所以不幸的是，他们分手了，或者不幸的是，他们结束了交往。

segments.en: They are no longer seeing each other.
That's right.
Okay.
But she said she had some good news because she met a really cute guy at a networking party.
segments.cn: 但她说她有好消息，因为她在一个社交聚会上遇到了一个非常可爱的男孩。

segments.en: What is networking?
Alright, so networking is something that you do, especially in the business world.
segments.cn: 好的，社交是你在商业世界中做的事情。

segments.en: You go to events, parties, happy hours, and you meet people.
segments.cn: 你去活动、聚会、欢乐时光，认识人。

segments.en: You meet strangers, and you talk about work, and you try to meet as many people as you can.
segments.cn: 你遇见陌生人，谈论工作，尽量认识尽可能多的人。

segments.en: Okay, so it's not really a social party to actually just go and meet random people.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这并不是一个社交聚会，实际上只是去见随机的人。

segments.en: You're trying to meet people that will be interesting for your business, or maybe to get some other ideas.
segments.cn: 你是想认识对你的业务有趣的人，或者获取其他想法。

segments.en: It's for a business purpose.
That's right.
So perhaps in your town, you own a small business, and your town has decided to have a Chamber of Commerce networking party, so you can meet other small business owners.
segments.cn: 所以也许在你的城镇，你拥有一家小企业，而你的城镇决定举办一个商会的社交聚会，这样你就可以认识其他小企业主。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
So that's what we have for language takeaway.
segments.cn: 这就是我们关于语言的总结。

segments.en: Let's go back and listen to our dialogue for the second time.
segments.cn: 让我们回去再听一次对话。

segments.en: Hey Michelle, is that you?
Wow, Grace, long time no see.
Where have you been?
Oh yeah, well, you see, I got a promotion, so I moved to the new Pudong office last September.
segments.cn: 哦，是的，你看，我升职了，所以去年九月我搬到了新的浦东办公室。

segments.en: You did?
Congratulations!
Thanks a lot.
So, how are things with you, Michelle?
Well, same old, same old, you know.
Nothing much has changed here.
Are you still seeing Chris?
No, actually, we split up last month.
segments.cn: 不，实际上，我们上个月分手了。

segments.en: Oh dear, I'm sorry to hear that, but I met a really cute guy last night at a networking party, so, well, let's just wait and see.
segments.cn: 哦，亲爱的，我很遗憾听到这个，但我昨晚在一个社交聚会上遇到了一个非常可爱的男孩，所以，嗯，我们就等着看吧。

segments.en: Good for you, Michelle!
All right, so now let's talk about these small, quick, but very useful phrases for small talk on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好的，现在让我们谈谈这些小而快速但非常有用的小谈短语在流利表达中。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
So this first phrase is a phrase that you'll hear a lot when people greet each other, but perhaps friends who haven't seen each other in a very long time.
segments.cn: 所以这个第一个短语是你在朋友之间打招呼时会经常听到的，尤其是很久没见的朋友。

segments.en: We use this phrase long time no see.
segments.cn: 我们使用这个短语“好久不见”。

segments.en: That's right.
Now, you look at it and it may seem like it's incorrect, right?
segments.cn: 现在，你看这个短语，可能会觉得它不正确，对吧？

segments.en: Because you're missing something.
segments.cn: 因为你缺少了一些东西。

segments.en: That's right, long time no see.
Who knows see?
What?
What long time?
That's right.
But this actually means I haven't seen you in a long time.
segments.cn: 但这实际上意味着我很久没见你了。

segments.en: That's right.
So the phrase is long time no see.
segments.cn: 所以这句话是“好久不见”。

segments.en: Hey, Michelle, long time no see, how are you?
segments.cn: 嘿，米歇尔，好久不见，你好吗？

segments.en: That's the way that you use it, but just take it as a phrase.
segments.cn: 这就是你使用它的方式，但就当作一句话吧。

segments.en: Don't try to analyze it too much.
So, hey Marco, long time no see.
segments.cn: 所以，嘿，马尔科，好久不见。

segments.en: That's right, okay.
And while they're talking and she's like, well, how are you?
segments.cn: 当他们在谈话时，她说，嗯，你好吗？

segments.en: And she says, well, you know, same old, same old.
segments.cn: 她说，嗯，你知道，老样子，老样子。

segments.en: All right, this is another one.
It doesn't look right.
It looks wrong.
But we do say this and twice, same old, same old.
segments.cn: 但我们确实这样说，老样子，老样子。

segments.en: And this means nothing has changed.
segments.cn: 这意味着没有什么改变。

segments.en: There's nothing really new in my life.
segments.cn: 我生活中没有什么新鲜事。

segments.en: Right, the same old things in my life, nothing really new or exciting, same old.
segments.cn: 对，生活中的老东西，没有什么新鲜或令人兴奋的，老样子。

segments.en: Exactly.
So I could say, hey, Marco, you know, how's the job going?
segments.cn: 所以我可以说，嘿，马尔科，你知道，工作怎么样？

segments.en: You know, same old, same old.
All right, so nothing has changed to his job.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以他的工作没有改变。

segments.en: He has not gotten a promotion.
That's right.
So now Michelle was again describing about the guy that she met at the networking party.
segments.cn: 所以现在米歇尔又在描述她在社交聚会上遇到的那个家伙。

segments.en: And she said, well, let's just wait and see.
segments.cn: 她说，嗯，我们就等着看吧。

segments.en: It seems like an incomplete sentence because let's wait and see what.
segments.cn: 这似乎是一个不完整的句子，因为等着看什么。

segments.en: All right, so let's wait and see what.
That's the question now.
You know, what are we waiting to see?
segments.cn: 你知道，我们在等着看什么？

segments.en: Well, she's basically saying, we don't know how things will go, but we, you know, we'll have to wait for the future to come before we can make a decision or figure out what's going on.
segments.cn: 嗯，她基本上是在说，我们不知道事情会如何发展，但我们，嗯，我们得等未来到来才能做决定或弄清楚发生了什么。

segments.en: That's right.
So, for example, Marco, we're at the office and I say, how is that report coming along?
segments.cn: 所以，例如，马尔科，我们在办公室，我说，报告进展如何？

segments.en: Is it, you know, were the numbers good?
And I can say, yeah, the numbers seemed all right, but we'll just wait and see.
segments.cn: 我可以说，是的，数字看起来还不错，但我们就等着看吧。

segments.en: Perhaps we don't have all the numbers yet.
segments.cn: 也许我们还没有所有的数字。

segments.en: So we have to wait to get the rest of them.
segments.cn: 所以我们得等着拿到剩下的。

segments.en: That's right.
So you're just basically saying, I don't know what will happen in the future.
segments.cn: 所以你基本上是在说，我不知道未来会发生什么。

segments.en: Let's just hope that it will be good and let's see what happens.
segments.cn: 让我们希望一切会好，看看会发生什么。

segments.en: Let's just wait and see.
Let's just wait and see.
All right.
So let's go back and listen to our dialogue one last time.
segments.cn: 所以让我们回去再听一遍我们的对话。

segments.en: Hey, Michelle, is that you?
Wow, Grace, long time no see.
Where have you been?
Oh, yeah.
Well, you see, I got a promotion, so I moved to the new Pudong office last September.
segments.cn: 嗯，你看，我升职了，所以去年九月我搬到了新的浦东办公室。

segments.en: You did?
Congratulations.
Thanks a lot.
So how are things with you, Michelle?
Well, same old, same old, you know, nothing much has changed here.
segments.cn: 嗯，老样子，老样子，你知道，这里没什么变化。

segments.en: Are you still seeing Chris?
segments.cn: 你还在和克里斯在一起吗？

segments.en: No, actually we split up last month.
segments.cn: 不，实际上我们上个月分手了。

segments.en: Oh, dear.
I'm sorry to hear that.
But I met a really cute guy last night at a networking party.
segments.cn: 但我昨晚在社交聚会上遇到了一个非常可爱的家伙。

segments.en: So well, let's just wait and see.
segments.cn: 所以，嗯，我们就等着看吧。

segments.en: Good for you, Michelle.
Okay, so this was another part of our small talk series.
segments.cn: 好吧，这又是我们闲聊系列的另一部分。

segments.en: As you see, very useful and quick little phrases so you can have a very brief conversation with maybe someone you haven't seen or a little chit chat at the office.
segments.cn: 如你所见，非常实用和简短的小短语，可以让你和可能很久没见的人进行简短的对话或在办公室闲聊。

segments.en: That's right.
And these are things that if you remember them, you memorize them, you can use in almost any conversation.
segments.cn: 这些都是如果你记住它们，背下来，就可以在几乎任何对话中使用的东西。

segments.en: Also, I'm sorry to hear that or good for you.
segments.cn: 还有，我很遗憾听到这个或祝你好运。

segments.en: These are really great phrases that are very, very flexible.
segments.cn: 这些都是非常灵活的好短语。

segments.en: That's right.
Actually, that's a really good one.
segments.cn: 实际上，这是一个非常好的短语。

segments.en: I'm sorry to hear that maybe someone gives you a little bit of bad news or something bad happened in their life.
segments.cn: 我很遗憾听到这个，也许有人给你带来了坏消息或他们生活中发生了不好的事情。

segments.en: It's very polite in a nice way of saying, hey, I understand.
segments.cn: 这是一种非常礼貌的方式，表示，嘿，我理解。

segments.en: I'm sorry to hear that.
That's right.
So we hope that you've learned something new in today's lesson.
segments.cn: 所以我们希望你在今天的课程中学到了新东西。

segments.en: If you have any questions about the phrases or words you've heard, please check out our website, EnglishPod.com, and leave us a question on the community section or in a note.
segments.cn: 如果你对你听到的短语或单词有任何问题，请查看我们的网站，EnglishPod.com，并在社区部分或留言中给我们留个问题。

segments.en: We'll be happy to answer them.
All right, guys.
We'll see you there.
Bye.
